metadata.title: Satellite Data - SeaWIFS, 1997-present
metadata.description: Satellite Imagery from September, 1997 to present; North America Pacific Coast from Baja California to the arctic.
keywords: North Inner Coast (QCS, Hecate, Dixon Inlet and passages)
South Inner Coast (Johnstone, Georgia, JDF, inlets and passages)
metadata.notes:
Purpose: Detection of phytoplankton blooms, biomass in the ocean.

Supplemental Information: Risk Justification: Data not secured in regional data centre. Data could be replaced but would require time and effort.
Risk of Loss: Medium
Impact Justification: Data are related to a subject, location or species of concern within the scientific,  government or public community within the last 5 years.
Impact of Loss: Medium
Recommended Action: Back up the CD collection, or, provide secured storage.

Status: In work

Maintenance frequency: None planned

Access constraints: Private

Use constraints: Data are under a non-disclosure licence with SeaWIFS.

Distribution liability: [unknown]

FGDC metadata date: 20080205

FGDC metadata standard: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata

FGDC metadata version: FGDC-STD-1998-1

Native data set environment: Expected Growth Rate: 60000MB

Distribution liability: [unknown]
Non-digital ordering: Hardcopy Original Exists: Y
Hardcopy Locations: John Wallace, IOS, Rm 2217
Hardcopy Description: "Quick look" satellite images, printed on paper and stored in binders.
Hardcopy Volume: About 20 3 in. binders (SeaWIFS and NOAA images, combined volume)
Fees: Ask Custodian
